page.title: 07FARMING IN AREA (CONT.)
page.content:
A call comes from the Vale of Evesham Friends of the Earth to county farmers to follow the National Farmers' Union code of practice for stubble burning. A few farmers have stopped burning stubble completely but in the absence of a total ban the Home Office have issued Revised Model Bye Laws making it an offence for flames to cross a fire break and so destroy hedges. The burning of oil seed rape straw and bean and pea straw is also covered. The Friends of the Earth feel that many uses exist for this surplus straw such as paper and board, fuel briquettes and animal feeds and that it is a disgraceful waste of resources to burn this straw in the open air.
Information based on local newspaper article - July '85
